abstract.text: Creates a single pixel buffer in planar format for a given size and pixel format containing data specified by a memory location.

parameter to use the default allocator. See

The width of the pixel buffer, in pixels.
The height of the pixel buffer, in pixels.
The pixel format identified by its respective four-character code (type
A pointer to a plane descriptor block if applicable, or
if it is not.
The size of the memory if the planes are contiguous, or
if it is not.
The number of planes.
The array of base addresses for the planes.
The array of plane widths.
The array of plane heights.
The array of plane bytes-per-row values.
The callback function that gets called when the pixel buffer is destroyed. This callback allows the owner of the pixels to free the memory. See
for more information.
A pointer to user data identifying the pixel buffer. This value is passed to your pixel buffer release callback.
A dictionary with additional attributes for a a pixel buffer. This parameter is optional. See
for more details.

abstract.text: Process digital video, including manipulation of individual frames, using a pipeline-based API and support for both Metal and OpenGL.
A reference to a Core Video pixel buffer object.
Creates a single pixel buffer for a given size and pixel format.
Creates a pixel buffer for a given size and pixel format containing data specified by a memory location.
Creates a single pixel buffer for the IO surface that you specify.
Creates a single pixel buffer in planar format for a given size and pixel format containing data specified by a memory location.
A type that defines a release callback function.
Defines a pointer to a pixel buffer release callback function, which is called when a pixel buffer created by
is released.
A Core Video error type return value.
The attributes associated with a pixel buffer.
Describes the result codes generated by Core Video operations.
CFAllocator provides the following predefined allocators. In general, you should use `kCFAllocatorDefault` unless one of the special circumstances exist below.
This is a synonym for `NULL`.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A signed integer value type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
